<OLD>
>
> Tucson turns his ear to Perceptor after hearing what Legacy had t=
o say. He smiles.
>
> " I can see how you got your name. Highly perceptive =
of you. Thank you Legacy, you've shed a lot of light on many of my question=
s. Now that I know my lineage, it's time I lived up to it. First things fir=
st, Perceptor and I could do with getting our sight back, and if you could =
do that I'd greatly appreciate it, Stanton. Next, we have insectoids hiding=
 beneath the Black Fortress tunnels, which have to be shown a lesson about =
tampering with what is not theirs. And Hydras last of all, could use a less=
on in that as well. Nobody tampers with any Autobot and gets away with it. =
Especially when they tamper with a Prime."

<NEW>

Legacy merely nodded, hi=
s single optic pulsing slightly as he accepted
Tuscon's words.

"We can wor=
k on getting your sight back Tuscon." Santon said, his tone
grave and serio=
us, "However I would need to run complete scans of
Perceptor to know if it =
is possible to do so. For some the damage can
be so extensive that it would=
 require a complete cranial
reconstruction to fix the problem."

> <OLD>
>
=
> He turns his head toward Rodimus.
>
> " They caused great harm to you Rod=
imus, and I'll see to it, with your help, that they get it back in return. =
If Optimus Prime could fend off Megatron, I'm sure I can follow in his foot=
steps, and fend off the enemy at hand. Both Hydras and Cylconus need to be =
dealt with accordingly. Rodimus voiced an interest in dealing with Hydras a=
nd so do I. Two Primes against an evil leader is sure to topple even the mo=
st evil of warlords. But our war does not end with just us. If we're going =
to send those Decepticons and Predicons packing, we'll need every Autobot a=
nd Maximal we have in our ranks to pull this off. Lord Elder, I'd like you =
to contact Lord Perseus, and assemble a Maximal/ Autobot assembly. The more=
 we get together, the stronger we'll be."

<NEW>

Rodimus was begining to l=
ook decidedly better as an intervenous tube
of energon continued to feed hi=
m energon in small but steady amounts.
He clutched his hand and then flexed=
 it, smiling as he did so. "Yes,
we need to do some serious pest control." =
he said as he looked up at
Tuscon.

Rodimus rubbed his chest with his hand,=
 "Don't forget Cyclonus, like
you has been rebuilt by the forces of the Mat=
rix, do not underestimate
his power." Rodimus frowned, "I did, and it cost =
us so very much."

Rodimus clenched his fist again, "But I am ready."

> <O=
LD>
>
> Talon smiled and said "Then I will need the help of LEgacy and Sant=
on.
> Rodimus"said the female "I think that would bee good idea that you be=
 there,
> if your health allows you"
>
> Perceptor did a malicious grin "An=
 excursion to BlackFortress wont be
> necesary... cause the only copy of al=
l my reseachs and reprogramation files
> are with me. Any rival scientist w=
ill use the fruits of my reseachs... With
> out my consent"

<NEW>

As the =
others talked Bump came in with Nightlight on the suspensor
bed, she was st=
ill unconscious. A small deep beeping told anyone
listening that she was in=
 deep stassis.

Legacy stepped over to the rear section of the room, away f=
rom the
others and gestured for Bump to bring her over as he began to exami=
ne
her. "From our initial scans, it would appear she is nearly blank, no
se=
condary modes or weapons, even her memory banks appear to be only
slightly =
formed." Legacy continued to scan, "However I am detecting
residual memory =
entries that have not been completely deleted. I do
not believe she cannot =
access them." He looked up at Tuscon, "I can
attempt to restore them."

(TA=
G)

Preston
